teG6bZzN-Zp_0cr8gf65Nw.text: Cherry Sushi did not impress me at all. The service was horrible. My brother ordered miso soup which he never got. I ordered the tri-color sushi which comes with miso soup and a salad. When my brother's two sushi rolls and my dish arrived, I realized the waitress brought me the wrong dish. She brought me the tri-color sashimi instead of the sushi (nigiri). I had to show her on the menu that these were two different dishes and that the nigiri was supposed to have rice with the fish. Then, I inquired about the miso soup we had ordered (since it should have been out before the main dishes). I got the soup and salad after that, but my brother did not receive his soup. However, after tasting the miso soup, I did not bother asking about his again. The soup was the most watered-down, flavorless miso soup I have ever tried. My brother was done with his dish before my correct dish arrived. On the plus side, the nigiri was pretty good. The sushi rolls were alright. I had also finished my drink before we got any of our food, and my drink was not refilled the entire time. My brother's drink was not either.  Upon getting our check, I saw that we were charged for two miso soups. Since my brother never got his and mine came as part of my meal, I had to ask to get this removed. However, my dish was listed as the tri-color sushi (not the sashimi), so at least that part was right. The pen I was given to sign the receipt with was out of ink. That was no big deal, just the icing on the cake. Overall, horrible service and terrible to good food. The price range was pretty average.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherry Sushi & Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Tri-color sushi

vjL9Ne-3-XyCSjsXavScSg.text: The food was not up to par with the other Cherry's in Lake Wylie. Disappointing the food was bland and not cooked on the Hibachi as told by waitress.

Av3bCyLqUvumVtunNZDtog.text: Dinner with the wife here last night. This is just ordinary asian fare comparable to the Red Bowl chain in the area. I had chicken lo mein that was decent but a portion too small for the price. Wife had orange chicken that was cooked too hard and hardly any orange sauce on it. We had a cali roll that was ok but wrapped kinda loose and it fell apart easily. The staff is nice, friendly and seemed capable but the quality of the food is lacking. I can't recommend Cherry Sushi & Grill and we won't be going back.

Rmfm7mOJw-Vr0_exEv707w.text: Worst sushi in Fort Mill.  And their hibachi noodles are a joke.  I was given spaghetti noodles with soy sauce.  No garlic, no onions,  nothing.  Just spaghetti noodles bathed in soy sauce.  I'd suggest you go two mins down the road to Lee Cafe.

3k3fEf-k02sEDv1uNYcUTA.text: Extremely slow service. Food sits on the shelf for what seems like forever while they prepare the rest of the meal. Was served cold hibachi chicken that was plated 10 minutes before they served it.  For $18.95, I at least expect it to be hot

eUnQzs3mJ1G0tNa3v4GKnQ.text: my best thoughts of our visit would be adequate......, nice place, server was quick, but no personality and was leaning over everybody......food was, buffet quality......i wondered when on a Friday evening, everything around it was packed, and they were empty.....

Y0EprsWQOXoYB4nVsHoKNA.text: Sushi has no flavor. Everything tasted the same and that is't a good thing. Expensive, poor service and bad food. Do yourself a favor and go to the sushi counter at Harris Teeter. You will be better off.

wxfirU6qOdVDSW5QifCPyw.text: Really hopeful about this place since there is no restaurant nearby  to my home in Springfield.  Was counting on having a "Baxter type Market Street" and am definitely disappointed.  The sushi was good and hubby had the Sesame Chicken.  Both quite tasty but a bit expensive.  Server was attentive although the restaurant was not busy on a Monday night. Probably will not return because the buy one get one free sushi deal at Akahana in Baxter is too good to pass up; plus their portions of Sesame Chicken, dumplings, lo mein, etc far exceed Cherry's portion.  And Akahana has a full bar in contrast to Cherry's wine/beer selection.  Maybe adding a full bar along with reasonably priced sushi will be in the future?  And more full service restaurants in Springfield Town Center?  If so count me in!  In the meantime the drive to Baxter will continue to be my preference.

tJdOentR_6LLsU4rxhXHrw.text: I have tried this restaurant twice and I wont be back. Both times there has been almost no one else in there and service was HORRIBLE. Our server never came back or even looked our way after we got our food and had to go up to the cashier to get the check. The food was mediocre compared to others like it in the area, with high prices, but it was the service that killed it for me. Disappointing.

42uD-fMOHW0lTIWl0wECLg.text: You need to hurry, because this place isn't going to be here much longer. The reasons: 1. Extremely overpriced for what is very mediocre. 2. The menu is confused, not only with concept, also with the sharpe corrections all over it. 3. The food... first we asked about their sushi boat a selection of sushi and nigiri. We were told the chef picks what we get. Ummm. Okay. $60 for this 1 item, I would like to pick what I get. So then I ordered 2 chef special sushi rolls. Put it this way. $24, 2 rolls, the first had a tempura shrimp in it and nothing else, then rice, then seaweed and on top cooked/warm canned tuna?!? It was awful and a disgrace to Asian cuisine.  The second was 1 piece of salmon, tuna, yellow tail and mean I piece of nigiri. Surrounded by a ring of cucumber. Before it was cut it would be a roll measured two inches in length. Pathetic.  4. The service. They had our table of 5 (us and 2 friends). Then another table of 3. We had a server per table. We ordered our apps, which came in 5 mins, our entrees about 3 mins after that. Then nothing, no drinks, no plate clearing for half an hour. To top it off they got the bill wrong. 5. Atmosphere. The local news is on a big screen tv?Country music is playing? Yet the prices are double most authentic restaurants around for the same dishes.  For myself, my wife and 2 year old son. 2 soft drinks, 1 app, 2 sushi rolls and 1 pre-frozen, flash fried orange chicken that was most likely out of a P.F. Chang's bag, $60 before t&t.  Expensive for what it was in comparison to other locals. All in all. Won't recommend. Won't return. That sushi roll, I'll never forget it, as the worst I've ever seen. Got to Harris teeter across the street. The nasty pre made is better.

9qdB6XNUB7cR0tOGJXoJ8w.text: Meh.  It was ok.  We love the location in Lake Wylie and decided to give it a try. Food was on par but the ambiance was terrible!  Feels like a subway station.  The waiter was clueless.  Our appetizers came AFTER our main dish. Who brings the hot food before the sushi?  Like 10 mins before the sushi!  I think it could be a nice place if they trained their staff.

lOr81QJgFLtuaFq4S_B18A.text: Food was superb, ordered hibachi dinners and they were delights. Customer service is why my review is only 2 stars; the music was awful- NOT family friendly....servers dancing around and singing so I will assume they chose the music. Staff louder than the guests. Does not seem to have management. Will order take-out next time.

C7TY_7KEKHTKFq66ddiEaQ.text: The restaurant only opened two days ago and service isn't what it needs to be yet. Overall the quality of the food is good.

Lz5Z0as_VZ43BHocI9EUdg.text: Me and wifey had a taste for sushi tonight and decided to meet here. I got to the restaurant first and went to the hostess desk. When I walked up she kept her head down, eventually looked up but continued to do what she was doing. Another party walked up from the bar and this hostess looked around me and asked them can I help you. I was very surprised she DID NOT acknowledge me at ALL. She went and sat the party then came back and asked can I help you. I don't know her name but she wore Purple or Raspberry Low Cut Converse. Hard to tell color in low lit restaurant. Our servers name was Savannah, she did a pretty good job and was very accommodating. The restaurant was very busy so I'm going to give her the benefit of the doubt on the slow service. The food was just OK, the sushi we had was very good. I will probably go back and give them another chance because of Savannah's service. If it was not for her I would probably not go back. Wifey said she feels the same about this visit but she has been here a few times before today with friends and said she received pretty good service during those visits.

zePSY6PWtsvWa9ed8T9wBg.text: The sushi was good and fresh. Will come back for sure.

-KTz0rKkSiDqKa9ztsA3bA.text: Costumer service here is really bad, i stood up and left after the food was served, the pictures on the menus don't belong the the restaurant. What i ordered was not the same as shown on the menus picture. The waiter told me they did not have what the picture shows even though the first waiter said they had it when i placed the order. They got into an argument with me even though i am the customer and did not offer to change my plate. So as i said i just left and i will never comeback

Sy5Vxsah3SJS4hkTjoN17w.text: 2nd time there for lunch. First time had sushi and very good, though napkins were dirty. 2nd time had hibatchi vegetable and was shocked at how small the portion was. Food came to table 10 minutes after my lunch partners did - no appology for delay (how hard is it to make vegy hibatchi?)  Spring roll came 5 minutes after that. Staff seemed unorganized. Will probably not go back. Again, small portions and no appologies for delays!!

gVdVCe1OJuqJyyF-Vu2mdA.text: I keep giving this place a chance and after four visits my experience is too much of a trend for me to think something will change.  I just came to the conclusion that I do not like this place and will not go back.    Like many of the other reviewer's have already stated, the service is poor, atmosphere is odd, ambiance is lacking and the food is just average at best.  Last night I sat and watched as two employees were embracing each other in the kitchen.  It was weird, lasted longer than it should have and is not something I want to see going on in a food preparation area.    In looking at other reviews, I suspect that this place will be short lived unless the owner takes serious action to right the ship. If you live around Springfield, convenience is the only thing they have going for them right now.

YoubcwR-2BltcM1T6afjkg.text: Dry chicken, replaced with over cooked shrimp.  Sushi was coming apart, fair flavor.  The dim sum was light on stuffing.   Good fried rice though.    Friendly staff but a little slow. Had a coupon for free entree with purchase of one, only took $3 off a roll instead of the other $4.50 roll when i got a &12 Bento box.   Was hoping for better.  Ahh well.

2qZe7WsB_Iz75pXOpR2cOQ.text: The restaurant was empty at 5pm on Friday night. The food is missing the Chinese ingredient. It was not good at all. Don't waste your money.

x6BLrThiAjuF3uvz-vb8zA.text: Not impressed. Won't be back.  I sat there forever before a serve came over. It wasn't even busy. I ordered the Bento Box and I have to say one good thing is that it's a lot of food. It came with Tempura shrimp and vegetables, rice, gyoza, sushi roll, soup, and salad for 12 bucks. Great deal. The sushi didn't taste fresh and it was kinda hard, like it had been pre-made and  refrigerated.  The rest wasn't bad, but wasn't great either . Just run of the mill. I expected a little better. So, no second chances here. I don't even have pics to show. It was that ordinary.

TgL4JiNchp4mxxTbNJjdTA.text: We had a very good experience here tonight. The food was amazing, the service was friendly and attentive and the kids loved it. We had the sweet and sour chicken, edamame and spring rolls- all very good. We will definitely be returning!

photos.caption: Photo of Cherry Sushi & Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Sweet and sour chicken

4MJwaPVIPEFdGoae94Buww.text: Service is just weird! The staff is inattentive, strange, almost annoyed that you walked in the door!! Food is just ok They will not last long with this kind of service! Very disappointing

FTbf_l8YXJBWE_qc_dQfGQ.text: I'm visiting from out of town and my mom- not exactly tech savvy- had seen this place many times driving by and wanted to try it. It's the first time I hadn't checked yelp reviews first and I wish I had! We had the avocado salad, spicy tuna roll, sweet potato roll, veggie tempura, veggie hibachi and tofu hibachi. The food was okay going down but as soon as we left the restaurant, our stomachs started hurting and we were both sick by the time we made it home. It's not like we were sick cuz we ate too much because there was a lot left over that we ended up throwing out in fear of getting sick again. I do NOT recommend this place at all!!!

Jzbw1zVFpx9M1X-madUqYQ.text: Probably won't be back. I had high hopes for this place! The atmosphere is nothing to crave. The country music chosen is a bit odd for this kind of place. I am waiting for my food, so this will make or break my decision of coming back. If I do, it will be carry out.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherry Sushi & Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States. The atmosphere is TERRIBLE!!!!!!

PGAHISAMjXkC5N862pImZQ.text: Great little asian place! Featuring really nice sashimi, nigiri, and hibachi! Sit down outside or take out. Nice little bar too. The staff is super friendly, but I really love how clean and fresh everything is and the price can't be beat! Definately going in my rotation for a fast quck sit  down or take out meal. Yay!

photos.caption: Photo of Cherry Sushi & Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Tro color sushi Sashimi perfect and super fresh
Photo of Cherry Sushi & Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Hibachi chicken with salad $13
Photo of Cherry Sushi & Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Happy teen, say what?

duUPFiLUPwa-qaUr4fw49g.text: Good portions, albeit a little pricy. Sushi was done very well, presentation of the dinner was top notch, flavors were astounding. Wish their General Tso was a little spicier, as I ended up chewing the accompanying peppers for any hint of heat, yet generally all around well done.  There appears to be a type of problem with asian-themed diners, in general, however. Their soda is always flat. I cannot recall the last time I went to an Asian restaurant and received soda that was properly balanced. Odd. Perhaps worth noting. Their tea was adequate.  Update: Ordered takeout on a weeknight, and all rice sides were coated with hair. We joked that a cook used it to wash their scalp, but that isn't too far off. Very hit or miss. Customer beware.

eSfBeK1IOmy8FbpkYsQXKw.text: The food wasn't bad just overpriced.  The Lo Mein noodles were spaghetti with soy sauce.  There were little gnats on the table.  I would not go back.

ez8WBNSam1d78V2z5o8R2g.text: I've given this place for tries. I give up.   Waitstaff.  2 stars.   Slow service.  Checked her phone more than she checked on the tables.  Hostess - nice but sat at a table staring at her phone  Food. 1 star     Kani salad -  terrible    Strings of Fake crab smothered in mayonnaise.  Yuck     Clear soup. -  no flavor (this is not like clear soup and other places)     Spring roll -   It was hollow!   Fried wrap with nothing inside.        Edamame was ok    Some were dried out     Chicken hibachi - over cooked and hard  I sure hope they can turn it around.

Moq7y4cZePRFccTQrT_vrg.text: I am not sure what the earlier reviews are talking about. I eat here once a week and always have great food and a lot of it. Service is consistent to all Asian restaurants. Key here is the food is great.

gVOQM8GnAwpAK5uKIWRHsw.text: I don't understand the negative reviews here. They made us hesitant in trying this place.  Our gluten free family of 7 thoroughly enjoyed both sushi and kitchen items. Our waitress was knowledgeable about gluten containing foods at the restaurant.  The fish was fresh, veggies fresh, friendly and attentive staff. We will definitely be back.   Tons of variety from meat eaters to vegans. Something for everyone.

If3ParReuvsn9TQUUtDoIA.text: Glad I ignored the yelp reviews...this place was good!  Sushi is by far some of the best in the Fort Mill area (definitely way better the red bowl).  We brought our 2 young children and they even had a nice kids menu.  Everything we got (including the kids food) was delicious.  The kids got tempura and hibachi...both excellent.  The adults had sushi which has to be the freshest and most delicious I've had locally.  We got one that had mango (which isn't my favorite but the wife likes it) and it was a really delicious roll.  All the flavors married together so nicely I would get it again despite the mango being in there.  The place wasn't very busy for a Friday (probably because of these reviews).  I certainly had a different experience than most on here.

38_51hgbbwoQWA3QDq3I1g.text: Not bad. My wife and I liked it. It has a few vegetarian options which was just what we needed.

YQacBXehj4L4h0CC4hyFpg.text: One of our family's favorite places.  We always get right in and good is delicious!  Surprised by some of the negative reviews since we have been here several times and always have a good experience.  I love the hibachi, husband loves the sushi rolls and kids love the fried rice & lo mein.

lA9Rry3MmxKD2oCze9PKoQ.text: Over priced for average food (hibachi). Traditional soup and salad is bland. Not relaxing. Friendly service was fair but no drink refill offered. Prices are too high for the quality, atmosphere and service and no "chef show" :)

Ur9hXPCpjfymnQtfYQ3q2g.text: Good sushi and hibachi. Love the hibachi noodles and the hot kiss roll! Restaurant is fairly new so they are still getting use to things, can't blame them for much.

ozidAP0Qn5vugR-QoKoX-w.text: I was quite excited about trying the food at Cherry Sushi & Grill, and so was my fiance. We had been watching their construction and couldn't wait for them to open. Well tonight we had take out, and i was not impressed. My boyfriend had a couple of different sushi rolls which he said where ok. I had the hibachi chicken and a side of rice. I would have given 3 stars but not even 30 mins after finishing our meals i was running to the bathroom. When i got my chicken it was cold, smelled odd and tasted rubbery but i ate it anyways because i paid $13 for it..which I am now regretting because it has upset my stomach...BAD. I have had hibachi chicken at tons of places but have never gotten sick after eating, which im assuming i was served bad chicken. I was really hoping that this place would be 5 stars, but no one should be running to the bathroom 30 mins after finishing a meal.

tCKambFsilE5ppRMztiCOA.text: Great experience! We had dinner around 6pm on Wed. We ordered the crab rangoon, house salads, the pink lady roll, and the shrimp tempura roll. Loved all of it! All of the ingredients were really fresh! Wait staff were friendly and attentive. Will be back.

o7jX2zg_nJ6Qn_-bnoOjIQ.text: Ugh. Ordered takeout and sushi was tepid and tasteless. And they sent me this salad. Can't recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherry Sushi & Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States. House Salad

we_PEaJ-D-pRCLWJh4AXWw.text: I ordered delivery from this restaurant, so I can't say anything about the service or environment, however, I can say that the food was far from meeting my expectations - and they were not high. I ordered crab Rangoon which was rubbery and likely did not contain any crab, as there wasn't much of anything inside the rubbery exterior (see photo). I also ordered a spicy tuna roll (which was the only thing I could stomach eating) and a Philadelphia roll which did not taste fresh. Overall, while the prices are good, I would never order from them again.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherry Sushi & Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Empty 6 Crab Rangoon

2l4Ss3_gTPFc2C4ey9YxPw.text: This place has great quality sushi! The all you can eat deal is worth every penny. Fish quality is top notch!

photos.caption: Photo of Cherry Sushi & Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States
Photo of Cherry Sushi & Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States

Zf9jI-SitEoi57W-nm1CCw.text: Issue with order being placed initially through uber eats. Got charged $8,000 then had to change cards. Tried calling restaurant several times and no answer. Called uber customer service and they picked up for them immediately and said they were going to work on it. Got food but was missing a $15 item and then found a metal shard in rice...yoikes

9H0gT2GRjAaIuZzQqi2RHw.text: Surprised I've not done a review yet!?  Have been coming here since it opened.  I sooo want this place to be spot on!  But it's not.  We have so few dining options and this has the potential to be very good!  I only wish management would invest in their employees and in turn, make them care about their regulars.  I've always ordered the same exact meal - filet hibachi.  Sometimes it's delish and sometimes it's not actually filet and terrible.  All too many times the service has been awful, as it was once again on my last visit.  6pm on a Friday - 4 other tables were already seated upon my arrival - only 1 server.  Really?  Only 1 server on a Friday night?  The hostess seated me.  I waited 15 minutes, watching more tables being seated and the server went right over to get their orders; walking right past me.    WRONG!  Yes, I am only 1 person, but I was here first!!!!  And I am a REALLY good tipper; especially in my neighborhood!  I eventually went up to the hostess and placed my order.    My meal was delivered by the server, who threw it on the table and left.  Never apologizing.  When I was finished, I waited a bit for a bill, it never arrived.  Went to register and asked the hostess for my bill.  Paid via CC and handed her a cash tip and instructed her to put it in her pocket - by no means did the server earn a dime!  This has been the story more times than I care to admit.    Please, please, please Cherry owners and management - empower your staff so they WANT to serve the neighborhood.  In turn, also please spend the money to properly staff the busy shifts.  The neighborhood IS giving up on you!

photos.caption: Photo of Cherry Sushi & Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States

uFh6VjyXpGAJNhJMvF018g.text: I met a friend here for lunch. Service was good and the sushi was also good. I opted for the lunch special, choosing three rolls for $12. The rolls were good, well assembled and tasted fresh.  The restaurant is clean and there's plenty of space. Lots of parking as it's at the opposite end of the lot from the Harris Teeter.  I'm sure I'll be back here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherry Sushi & Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Three rolls at Cherry Sushi in Fort Mill
Photo of Cherry Sushi & Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Inside Cherry Sushi in Fort Mill
Photo of Cherry Sushi & Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Cherry Sushi in Fort Mill

B5abUeRyC9NzPVaduk7XaQ.text: This place sucks! When this place first opened the food was good and tasty, they gave a lot of food, and the place was nice.  I am not sure if they changed owners or what has happened, but now they suck! BIG TIME!  The food no longer tastes good and they do not give as much food as they used to.  It takes at least  3 BAD experiences for me to stop going to a restaurant.  The past four times at Cherry have been really bad.  The last time, today:  It looks like they cooked my food on a dirty grill after burning some food.  My Hibachi Chicken has black dots and burned gunk mixed in with it.  NO more!  This place is close to my job, so I was really hoping this was not happening, However it is happening...I'm done.  THIS PLACE SUCKS!

SVE1WE07vzqsIBZM2sQzPA.text: I think the hibachi was very good. We had an unusual take of lighter fluid and I think the chef used the wrong bottle. But I would try it again with hopes that was a mistake. My only complaint, except for the fuel taste is with most hibachi places. If you are cheaping the vegetable in the fried rice to cut it down to 3 tablespoons to save a buck. I assure you if you go the opposite, people will notice and you will get more steady customers. People go back to places that care about the quality of the food and not a profit of 3 cents more on each people served. I used to get a fried rice with all sort of veggies, now I see only egg with a speck or two of veggies. Also like to have ginger sauce with the Hibachi. Two sauces are standard in most restaurants. Will be back to try again

5rM5PPLcOBX6-gEy-Lj9xQ.text: Cherry Sushi & Grill has never disappointed me, with the countless times I've been there. I always go for the California Roll and the Shrimp Tempura Roll, and while they could have a little bit more flavor, the food is still good. I always take some food from my mom when she's eating, and the Chinese and Japanese cuisine are better than the takeout you can get at the other Chinese restaurants. The staff are always kind and excited to see you when you walk in the door, and I've never had anyone mess up an order. While I've never had the dessert, as it is a little pricy, it all looks good, as the images on the menu look like the real thing. I hope you have an excellent time at Cherry Sushi & Grill.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherry Sushi & Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States

wj7FdnEQ4I6x9sT0LInUnA.text: Food is always very good. Since discovering they deliver we usually order in. They are always on time.

6KL2rG7qzAlD8SeEEmx9mQ.text: Just got back from Cherry.  It was awful!  My son ordered chicken with garlic sauce. Daughter in law ordered steak hibachi. I ordered shrimp hibachi. Steak was COLD. My shrimp were burned. All the three sauces tasted exactly the same. We will never go here again.   Try Wild East at Carmel Rd and rt 51. Stellar Chinese. Asian. Thai. Sushi. Great service too and everything is not greasy and tastes different from each other. Cherry needs a REAL  Asian chef who Knows their sauces and how to cook. It stinks big time !

K1yavy0HzsKNKMrBzvKvfA.text: The place was almost empty for  dinner, but we wanted to give it a try.  The miso soup was ok, and the small salad had a pleasant fresh dressing.  We didn't like the plain fried rice; texture and flavor were lacking.  As it seemed a slow day for the restaurant,  we didn't want to order only sushi.   We ordered the Bento Box  and the Hibachi chicken.  The chicken had a delicious smokey sauce. The noodles  looked strange,  like fine spaghetti.  We ordered green tea and it was awful. A  teabag in warm water that tasted strongly of chlorine.  Service was pleasant and they corrected the mistake in our check manually at our table. In summary, our experience was average and a  little bit expensive for what we ordered.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherry Sushi & Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Hibachi chicken
Photo of Cherry Sushi & Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Bento box

maVOq5UC62K7cYXqkKIY0g.text: Food was excellent! The sushi was delicious! All You Can Eat menu was amazing ! I would recommend this if you are into Japanese food.

pvmGGZ5lAn3ub7dB21qktw.text: This is a really good place to eat and chill. Been here 3 times. Food was amazing. No complaints at all. Japanese hibachi Chinese food all in 1 place. That too good quality and not pricey at all. What else do u want. Amazing special sushi rolls. I haven't had a bad experience yet. Great staff and service too.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherry Sushi & Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Cherry Blossom Roll(amazing), Kani Salad, Kungpao Chicken and Garlic Shrimp Spicy. Loved it.

jX4G6RAo2a7MWjldhQbTmQ.text: High expectations and unfortunately highly disappointed.  Given the pricing at this location and the type of food offered, one would believe that the quantity and quality would reflect the price. Unfortunately, it does not.   Based on other reviews, the location is well appointed being in a new location in Fort Mill, SC that is lacking in the restaurant and food scene. However, there are other nearby Asian/Sushi restaurants that are worth the drive for a better experience such as Baxter, Pineville, Uptown, etc).  The restaurant interior is cold and uninviting and actually very odd. It is not inviting and the tables and locations are very open.  With all this being said, I think the pictures of the recent takeout we received proves my point. Salad contained a lot of water, noodles had no taste, fried and white rice tasted the same, etc.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherry Sushi & Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Miso Soup was just broth, plus three mushrooms?
Photo of Cherry Sushi & Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States. &#34;Noodles&#34; from hibachi were just regular pasta noodles.
Photo of Cherry Sushi & Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Watery Salad.

ajUkIuKXe_yYJu5U0WOpbQ.text: Pretty average sushi I had the Snow White Roll was good but not $12 good and the House salad was very small. My husband had the Green Dragon said it was too sweet tasting but he enjoyed the Hamachi Roll. I was still hungry so ordered edamame that was good and good sized portion. Staff was friendly and place was clean three stars due to price being high for what it was.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherry Sushi & Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Green Dragon very sweet and Hamachi Love good
Photo of Cherry Sushi & Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Snow White Roll and Green dragon and Hamachi Love

o4s79dkdXKUjnYir_nY6NQ.text: First time here for lunch. Great service and tasty food. Spicy tuna roll was great and Hibachi steak was very well seasoned and tasty combined with brown rice.   Update 5/27/16 brought the family back for dinner. Everyone really loved their food, and great service.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherry Sushi & Grill - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Spicy Tuna roll and godzilla roll. Very tasty!!!

DKg4vOgUXv-6whfGsbG0kA.text: Pretty good so far, compared to the other sushi places I tried in the area! Everything we had was fresh and even the hibachi was good. The only downside was presentation. I really wish the chefs cooked out in front of you like other Places do that serve it

1zmTg7agb_I2GXM8BPhPOg.text: Very odd, I only received one roll out of three that I ordered for take out. The other two rolls were weird tempura flakes and minced crab. I took a chance here and lost.
